diff_hunk:
@@ -722,11 +722,33 @@ def load(module, prefix=''):
             raise RuntimeError('Error(s) in loading state_dict for {}:\n\t{}'.format(
                                self.__class__.__name__, "\n\t".join(error_msgs)))
 
-    def parameters(self):
+    def _named_members(self, get_members_fn, memo=None, prefix='', recurse=True):
+        r"""Helper method for yielding various names + members of modules."""
+        if memo is None:
+            memo = set()
+        modules = self.named_modules(prefix=prefix) if recurse else [(prefix, self)]
+        for module_prefix, module in modules:
+            members = get_members_fn(module)
+            for k, v in members:
+                if v is None or v in memo:
+                    continue
+                memo.add(v)
+                name = module_prefix + ('.' if module_prefix else '') + k
+                yield name, v
+
+    def parameters(self, memo=None, recurse=True):
         r"""Returns an iterator over module parameters.
 
         This is typically passed to an optimizer.
 
+        Args:
+            memo (set): if specified, excludes the enclosed parameters from
body:
I would ideally like two desiderata:

- `parameters` consistent with `named_parameters` (either both use memo or none use memo)
- Don't break backwards compatibility.

I will have to give one of these up 😦 Any suggestions as to which?
